title: Nature Towns and Cities: Creating Greener Neighbourhoods and Brighter Futures

content.text: David Drake, Director, People & Nature at Natural England

Did you know 47% of people do not currently have access to green space within 15-minutes' walk of home? Nature Towns and Cities aims to transform this reality, enabling millions of people to experience nature as part of their daily lives.
Spending time in nature boosts our mental and physical health, cuts healthcare costs, and drives economic growth—helping our country thrive.

Bringing green spaces into our towns and cities revitalizes communities in multiple ways—creating vibrant social hubs where people connect, attracting valuable investment to boost local economies, and building natural resilience against climate change, one of the greatest threats facing our future prosperity.
Nature Towns and Cities is embedding nature into the heart of local plans and placemaking to create lasting change across the UK, tackling challenges from environmental equity to air pollution.
When nature lives nearer, we all live better

The programme has united a powerful coalition across public, private and third sectors—established by Natural England, The National Lottery Heritage Fund and the National Trust, with expertise from NatureScot, Natural Resources Wales and the Northern Ireland Environment Agency.
Renewed Neighbourhoods Through Green Infrastructure
Natural England's role in Nature Towns and Cities

Our Green Infrastructure Framework supports the government’s economic growth priorities by targeting investment where it can deliver the most returns. Green Infrastructure mapping data pinpoints nature-deprived areas with precision, ensuring Green Infrastructure strategies help to bring nature to communities with the greatest need. Our evidence-based standards support the Government's vision that everyone can access quality green space close to home.

We're working with towns and cities across the UK to help create ambitious plans that connect city parks, street trees and community gardens into living networks that work for wildlife and people. By linking urban green spaces with wider ecosystems, we're ensuring that nature and people thrive in the urban landscape —transforming towns and cities into healthier, more resilient places for everyone.
Transforming the UK’s towns and cities through nature

We’re growing a suite of resources, expertise and practical support, providing communities and local authorities with the tools they need for their journey to create greener, more resilient urban spaces.

Nature Towns and Cities gives local government, community organisations, charities and professionals across the UK an opportunity to connect with each other, sharing knowledge and solving collective challenges.

The events calendar covers a wide range of topics, featuring case studies and proven solutions. You can come together with others working towards similar goals in small workshops, peer learning sessions and large conferences. And a resource library offers the chance to build your knowledge and spark new ideas. Case studies provide inspiration showing how others have made change happen, and step-by-step guides give you what you need to get started.
